pr_title: HBASE-24974: Provide a flexibility to print only row key and filter for multiple tables in the WALPrettyPrinter

timeline.message: HBASE-24974: Provide a flexibility to print only row key and filter for multiple tables in the WALPrettyPrinter

timeline.bodyText: nit: "Only lof entries for these tables..."
timeline.author: wchevreuil

timeline.bodyText: nit: for clarity, shouldn't we name it as tableSet instead of tableList? Or maybe better to use List/ArrayList.
timeline.author: wchevreuil

replies.bodyText: +1, and this should be final too.
replies.author: virajjasani

replies.bodyText:
I used Set since every WALEntry is going to search in the Set which is optimal for search.
as @virajjasani  pointed out in another comment
replies.author: sandeepvinayak

timeline.bodyText: Is HashSet really needed here? Can this be a simple ArrayList?
timeline.author: wchevreuil

timeline.bodyText: Let's be more direct: "Prints only row keys".
timeline.author: wchevreuil

timeline.bodyText:
This can be replaced with:
    Collections.addAll(tableList, tableListWithDelimiter.split(","));
timeline.author: virajjasani

timeline.bodyText:
Looks like this efficient search with contains() is the reason behind using Set instead of List.
Btw, (TableName) is redundant cast here.
timeline.author: virajjasani

timeline.bodyText: nit: I think the second condition covers the first one.
timeline.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: I think we need the first one where we don't pass -t param and set is Empty. In that case, the second one will always skip all the tables. @bharathv
replies.author: sandeepvinayak
